page.title: 05SAND BAY SALT MARSH
page.content: In early July the saltmarsh is rather nice, the plants are really colourful and you can see right out to Flat Holm. There are many plants such as Sea Aster, Cord grass and Grasswort. As you go further out on the saltmarsh the grasses turn into mud. There are a lot of channels going out to the sea, some of them have water and some do not. There is an abundance of wildlife on the marsh and in the mud there are ragworms and crabs that live in the trenches. There might even be musk-rats living in the banks. Shelduck are to be found in quite considerable numbers on the fringe of the marsh.
